page.title: 16CAUSEY MOUNTH
page.content: { Causey Mounth}is the road through Banchory-Devenick going{south}from the banks of the Dee . It climbs from Aberdeen up Tollowhill to the Banchory - Devenick Crossroads then past Causey -port Farm towards the new dual- carriageway, the A92 to Stonehaven. This was the original route from the time of the earliest settlements. By this roadway are{standing stones and a {burial circle from the Bronze Age.}The {Romans}travelled on this to & from their camp at Culter. Between the Crossroads & Causeyport Farm a {causeway}was built crossing Haremoss bog. This area has since been drained but the road is still elevated. At the farm a{port or gate charged a toll}to road users. Traffic increase and the route's limitations caused a new {turnpike road}to be laid from Aberdeen to Stonehaven which{opened in 1785.
